newsitem.title: USA: American Safety Razor to buy cotton unit.
newsitem.headline: American Safety Razor to buy cotton unit.

text.p: American Safety Razor Co said on Friday it agreed to acquire the cotton division of American White Cross Inc for $10 million in cash and the assumption of certain obligations.
The obligations are primarily customer and supplier orders, the company said.
The acquisition, which is expected to have a "nominal" effect on 1997's earnings, is an attempt to broaden American Razor's product line of health and beauty products, the company said.

The cotton division makes and distributes private-brand and value-brand cotton swabs, cotton rounds and squares, cotton balls and puffs, pharmaceutical coil, and cotton rolls, American Safety said. American White Cross is currently bankrupt.
The acquisition will be accounted for as a purchase transaction and will be financed primarily with additional borrowings under the existing credit facilities.
American Safety said the agreement is subject to approval by Bankruptcy Court and certain other conditions. The transaction is expected to be completed by late April 1997.
